briefdescription.para: Returns bit number b from int a.

detaileddescription.para: The bit number is zero based. Relevant b values are from 0 to 31 Equals to (a >> b) & 1

briefdescription.para: Returns a hash value for a integer vector.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vector3 p0, Vector3 p1, Vector3 p2, Vector3 p3, float t)
memberdef.name: CubicBezier

briefdescription.para: Returns a point on a cubic bezier curve.

memberdef.argsstring: (int x, int z, int px, int pz, int qx, int qz)
memberdef.name: DistancePointSegment

briefdescription.para: Returns the approximate shortest distance between x,z and the line p-q.

detaileddescription.para: The line is considered infinite. This function is not entirely exact, but it is about twice as fast as DistancePointSegment2.

memberdef.argsstring: (int x, int z, int px, int pz, int qx, int qz)
memberdef.name: DistancePointSegment2

briefdescription.para: Returns the distance between x,z and the line p-q.
Returns the distance between c and the line a-b.
Returns the squared distance between c and the line a-b.

detaileddescription.para: The line is not considered infinite.

briefdescription.para: Returns a nicely formatted string for the number of bytes (kB, MB, GB etc).

detaileddescription.para:
Uses decimal values, not binary ones
FormatBytesBinary

briefdescription.para: Returns a nicely formatted string for the number of bytes (KiB, MiB, GiB etc).

detaileddescription.para: Uses decimal names (KB, Mb - 1000) but calculates using binary values (KiB, MiB - 1024)

briefdescription.para: Returns a point on a hermite curve.

detaileddescription.para: Slow start and slow end, fast in the middle

briefdescription.para: Returns a nice color from int i with alpha a.

detaileddescription.para: Got code from the open-source Recast project, works really good Seems like there are only 64 possible colors from studying the code

briefdescription.para: Distance between two points on the XZ plane.
Maps a value between startMin and startMax to be between 0 and 1.

memberdef.argsstring: (float startMin, float startMax, float targetMin, float targetMax, float value)
memberdef.name: MapTo

briefdescription.para: Maps a value between startMin and startMax to be between targetMin and targetMax.
Maps a value (0...1) to be between targetMin and targetMax.
Returns the closest point on the line.

detaileddescription.para:
The line is treated as infinite.
NearestPointStrict

briefdescription.para: Factor of the nearest point on the segment.

detaileddescription.para: Returned value is in the range [0,1] if the point lies on the segment otherwise it just lies on the line. The closest point can be got by (end-start)*factor + start;

briefdescription.para: Factor of the nearest point on the segment.

detaileddescription.para: Returned value is in the range [0,1] if the point lies on the segment otherwise it just lies on the line. The closest point can be got by (end-start)*factor + start;

briefdescription.para: Returns the closest point on the line segment.

detaileddescription.para:
The line is NOT treated as infinite.
NearestPoint

briefdescription.para: Returns the closest point on the line segment on the XZ plane.

detaileddescription.para:
The line is NOT treated as infinite.
NearestPoint

briefdescription.para: Squared distance between two points on the XZ plane.
Utility functions for working with numbers, lines and vectors.
